issues.description: The problem statement specifies that every class/interface must be declared public, including the Pneumatic interface (see UML and remarks), but in the solution repository Pneumatic.java defines the interface without the public modifier. This visibility mismatch contradicts the requirement and could confuse students about the intended visibility of interfaces.
issues.suggested_fix: Add the public keyword to the Pneumatic interface declaration in Pneumatic.java (e.g., `public interface Pneumatic { ... }`) to align with the problem statement requirement.
